text: 13 years after her father died responding to the sept. 11 , 2001 attacks on the world trade center , josephine smith is carrying on his legacy by becoming the first daughter of a 9/11 responder to join the new york fire department . it was an emotional moment for smith , 34 , graduating the fdny academy tuesday , full of pride for her family but sadness that ` my father could n't be here . ' ` i 've made it a mission to make sure that i fulfilled my dream of becoming a city firefighter and following in my father 's footsteps , ' she said , crying shortly after the service ended . josephine smith is the first daughter of a 9/11 responder to join the new york fire department . josephine smith 's father kevin was among the 340 firefighters killed in the 9/11 attack on the world trade center . nbc news that smith 's father kevin was in one of the units that faced the most danger . about 340 firefighters died in the attack , which happened when smith was 21-years-old . ` kevin was a part of one of the units hit most hard that day : hazmat 1 , ' mayor bill de blasio told the graduates . ` josephine out of that tragedy devoted herself to service . ' the graduation has been a longtime goal for smith who used to follow her dad to work and play on the fire engines . mother angela clay believed that were kevin here today he 'd be an extremely proud father and would 've had words of advice for his girl : ` do a good job . keep your head straight . your heart in it . and love your job . ' most important , angela said , ` she 's made herself proud about what she 's accomplished today . and that 's our goal with her .
